intro: Acourtia queretarana, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Acourtia queretarana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
